title: What types of technology are used in a law office? - Quora

response.answer_text: Technology has impacted every business and legal sector is not exceptional. For reducing the workload and increasing business efficiency, law office started adopting new tools to streamline their time-consuming process such as managing paper documents, contract discovery, legal research and writing, etc. Types of technology used in the law office – Document Management System – Utilization of document management software is common some of the software’s are dMACQ DMS, EisenVault, GreytHR, etc. These help in streamlining paper documents efficiently.Electronic Discovery – E-discovery helps to identify and produce relevant, electronically stored information in the litigation process.Time and billing software – Time and billing software removes the hassle from time-tracking and collections of payments. So choosing a reliable software is essential. There are some commonly used software's available in the market such as Clio, Mycase, PracticePanther Legal, etc.However, whether you are heading a small office or big law firm, rather than investing in new technology and training your staff, it is better to outsource non-core legal processes. You can easily save time, cost and efforts.

Many law firms were resistant to using email even into the mid-2000s. Now, lawyers are reaping the rewards of investing in: automation tools which have reduced administrative costs; cloud solutions which have enabled agile working; and AI research tools which have introduced efficiencies and competitive advantages. Following are few technologies, a legal firm needs in today’s competitive scenario: AI and machine learning Legal AI solutions are essentially sophisticated methods of teaching computers with predictive analysis to carry out routine tasks. Cloud computing Moving Legal IT infrastructure to cloud for flexible working environment & improved cost efficiencies. Big Data and legal research This refers both to very large sets of data, as well as the processes used for capturing, analysing and extracting value from these data sets. Automation Many billing, administrative and secretarial processes have already been automated to a lesser or greater degree - particularly in larger firms which have invested in legal tech. DIY law and chatbots Although legal tech is often designed to help law firms, it's also increasingly being targeted towards potential clients who are willing to do some of the groundwork themselves. Legal tech: threats and opportunities Legal tech developments present an opportunity for many established firms looking to make efficiency gains and adapt to an increasingly popular agile working culture. I came across similar interesting information on this blog, check it out - Legal Technology Trends

Having helped market a personal injury firm I know a few attorneys that use: Case management software such as Needles. Most use traditional Microsoft Office applications, word, excel, outlook. Westlaw and other Thomson Reuters application/services are common. Google AdWords for search advertising and larger firms tend to add television into the mix. Many firms use third party online chat providers and digital phone number/systems to track and connect with potential clients. If you are an attorney or law firm seeking technology solutions I can help point you in the right direction.

I would guess that every law office uses the basic technologies -- computers, scanners, fax machines, etc.  Some law offices with a leaning towards representing technical clients might have their own "technical experts" in-house or on retainer, so they could have a basic lab or IT lab set up.
